intro: Anthyllis vulneraria f. insularis, commonly known as the Island woundwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a distinctive appearance that helps it stand out in its native habitat. This subspecies is often found on islands, where it has adapted to specific environmental conditions.
